description: Access is the database application within the Microsoft Office suite.  Many businesses, large and small, use Access to store large amounts of information. Just like building a a strong house, you must have a solid foundation. We start from the very beginning discussing how to plan a database, introducing basic terminology and key concepts of relational database design, and exploring the Access Interface. Then we dive more in depth into each object in an Access databases - tables, queries, forms, and reports.  This series is targeted for users who want to get started in Access or users that want a refresher on Access essentials.  Access is a Windows only product and only available as a local installation.

Just like building a a strong house, you must have a solid foundation. Then we dive more in depth into each object in an Access databases - tables, queries, forms, and reports.  This series is targeted for users who want to get started in Access or users that want a refresher on Access essentials.  Access is a Windows only product and only available as a local installation.
name: Access 2016 Essentials
subtitle: Database application

episodes.description: Access is the database application within the Microsoft Office suite. Many businesses, large and small, use Access to store large amounts of information. Just like building a a strong house, you must have a solid foundation. We start from the very beginning discussing how to plan a database, introducing basic terminology and key concepts of relational database design, and exploring the Access Interface. Then we dive more in depth into each object in an Access databases - tables, queries, forms, and reports. This series is targeted for users who want to get started in Access or users that want a refresher on Access essentials. Access is a Windows only product and only available as a local installation.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: The dynamic dou of Vonne and Ronnie are back together to bring you Access 2016. In this episode, they review the basic question of what is Access, where it belongs in the Office suite, and other introductory topics.
episodes.title: Introduction to Access

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne introduce the concept of a database with a great analogy - laundry! They discuss the importance of organizing data and how the data relates to one another. They also discuss how Excel and Access differ in how they interact with data. They then take a trip down memory lane with examples of analog databases.
episodes.title: What is a Database

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne define and explain key terms in general databases and Access.
episodes.title: Database Terminology

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne had so much fun defining terms, they had to make a part 2! They continue to explain key terms in general databases and Access.
episodes.title: Database Terminology Part 2

episodes.description: Don't know where to begin in building a database in Access? Luckily, Access has templates to get you going.  Ronnie and Vonne explore creating a template database and indentify what Acccess creates for us.
episodes.title: Getting Started in Access

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie explore the Access interface. They identify the title bar, quick access toolbar, ribbon, status bar, and navigation pane.
episodes.title: Access Interface and Navigation

episodes.description: Prior proper planning prevents poor performance. Vonne and Ronnie talk about the importance of planning out a database and review basic concepts of relational database design.
episodes.title: Planning and Database Design

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie continue their discussion about planning a database.  Specifically, they review how they determined the fields needed in their tables for the show's database. They also touch upon the concept of data normalization.
episodes.title: Planning and Database Design Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie create their first table in a new database. They create fields and determine data types in the design view. They also review the field properties. Lastly, they enter in records in the datasheet view.
episodes.title: Creating Tables: Manual Data Entry

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie continue to create tables in Access 2016.  They discuss the reason to import data and show how Access tools can help us quickly build our tables to get them ready for use.
episodes.title: Creating Tables: Importing External Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie continue to create tables in Access 2016.  They discuss the reason to import data and show how Access tools can help us quickly build our tables to get them ready for use.
episodes.title: Creating Tables: Importing External Data Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie help you to understand relationships between tables.  They discuss the most common types of table relationships. Using Access, they show how to make those relationships work.
episodes.title: Creating Table Relationships

episodes.description: After reviewing the concepts of relationships in the previous episode, Vonne and Ronnie are back to demonstrate how to create table relationships in Access.
episodes.title: Creating Table Relationships Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie introduce queries in Access. They review the different types of queries available and run a simple select query through the query wizard.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Desgin

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie are back with more on queries. In this episode, they create queries in the design view and even show how to write a very simple SQL query.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Design Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne share some of the issues they discovered in their database from running queries. In this episode, they show problems with mismatched entered data as well as mismatched data types.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Design Part 3

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne continue to share some of the issues they discovered in their database from running queries. In this episode, they reveal issues with the relationships between tables and demonstrate how to fix them.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Design Part 4

episodes.description: In the final episode of the query mini-series, Vonne and Ronnie discuss some of the final issues they discovered in their database design.  They reestablish some more table relationships and add fields to correct some logic issues with the data.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Design Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie discuss the importance of forms in Access. They show how to create a form using the form button and introduce the concept of a subform. They end the episode with a brief introduction to the form wizard.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Forms

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie are back with more on forms in Access. They continue with the form wizard, demonstrating the different layouts that are available. They also create a basic form from the blank form button.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Forms Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie create a form in design view. They demonstrate how to add label controls and how to manipulate their placement in the form.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Forms Part 3

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie wrap up the Access forms miniseries by demonstrating some key layout and design formatting.  They show how to align and distribute form elements, explore the layout view, and add a combo box control.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Forms Part 4

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne introduce us to reports in Access. They discuss the importance of good reports to summarize and display the information in your database.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie show how to create reports. They create mailing labels, use the report button, start from a blank report, and walk through the report wizard. They also show how to modify report layouts in the layout view.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports Part 2

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie are back with more reports in Access. In this episode, they explore creating a report in the design view (banded report writer). They explain the different sections of the banded report writer and how to summarize data with the group and sort command.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne dive deeper into building reports in design view. They demonstrate what happens when you add a field into a report that does not have a relationship established to the current report.  They show how to create a calculated field with expression builder as well as summarize data in the section footer. Finally, they begin to build a query as an alternative way to create a report.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports Part 4

episodes.description: In this final episode, Ronnie and Vonne create a report from a table created from a query. They show us how to create a concatenated field in the query to ultimately create a section header in the report. They also review how to align and format fields as well as change background colors of the different sections.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports Part 5
